org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Tacoma in and for Pierce County

The State late
the Territory of Washington, on the relation of George Hazzard, Plaintiff, vs.
James H. Price and M. G. Aguirre, Defendants

Comes now the plaintiff George Hazzard and gives notice to said James H> Price and M. G. Aguirre and to their attorney Fremont Campbell that he will have a statement of facts settled in said cause for use in the appellate court on the 26th day of November 1889 at the house of 11 oclock a.m. by the Honorable Frank Allyn, Judge of the said court, at his Chambers, at the Court House in the City of Tacoma, Washington. The said statement of facts to be settled under the provisions of an act of the legislative assembly of Washington Territory, approved November 23rd, 1883, entitled "An act in relation to the removal of causes to the Supreme Court".
John Palmer Herbert S. Griggs and PC Sullivan
